LJava
Class Formula<P,R>

java.lang.Object
  LJava.Association
      LJava.Relation
          LJava.Formula<P,R>
Type Parameters:
P - - the arguments type of the function f that gets overrode.
R - - the return type of the function f that gets overrode.
All Implemented Interfaces:
LJ.QueryParameter
public abstract class Formula<P,R>
extends Relation

Author:
Tzali Maimon Formula is LJ's function object. From here you can create a logical formula and as result - a function (an n+1 dimension Formula is an n dimension function).

Formula requires you to override the inner function that it should activate on call.

One main use for Formula is defining infinite many Relations with one entry into the "world" of LJ

For example if you associate a formula that sums up two numbers, then you defined the rule "x,y,z where x=y+z".

invoke

public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object... params)
returns the invoking result of f on the given params.

The difference between invoke and value is that invoke accepts any Objects as params and returns an Object as a result.

This allows you to bypass Java's compiler types errors but at a risk of getting undefined return (about undefined read LJ class java doc)

Parameters:
params - - arguments
Returns:
and object that might be of type R or undefined
